data.title: VScode support to start minimized/below other windows
data.body:
When opening VSCode for running tests, maybe it would be better to avoid window appearing in front of all windows. It's annoying to toggle between vscode's windows on MacOS.

It would be useful to have an cli arg like `--minimized` to avoid it.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 - 6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.2

data.title: Feature Request: Open Code from stdout
data.body:
I think there could be some interesting uses for being able to populate the contents of a new Untitled document from stdout via command-line. I frequently dump data from a process to a file and open it in Code, but that's usually not a file I want to save, I just want to view the contents in Code. This functionality would save me several steps.

For example:
```powershell
PS C:\> '{"key": "value"}' | code
```
Would start up Code like this.

![code_2017-04-17_16-27-18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/114173/25103489/bf83351e-238a-11e7-932b-6791f6d61264.png)

data.title: Extension host terminated unexpectedly. Please reload the window to recover.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2 (BUT was happening when upgrading to 1.11.1
- OS Version: Win7

Basically, I get this error (along with VSCode not responding) because there are too many Git changes. If I set git.enabled to false, the problem is fixed, but this issue wasn't happening before V 1.11.1

I work with large theme template files that I do not push to Git, but I would like to keep the feature enabled for projects that I do push to Git.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open theme folder
2. Git changes load and crash the window

data.title: Added support for encodings for Git.
data.body:
Fixes #21146

**Bug**
Git always uses utf8 encoding for retrieving file contents.

**Fix**
Pass the 'files.encoding' configuration property to the git-extension and use this encoding to decode git output.

data.title: Request to update atom/language-c version to the latest.
data.body: The latest version of atom/language-c in the master branch has an important regression bug fix in the C++ scenario (L'c' is causing all the remaining characters to colorize as a string). The VS Code Insiders build doesn't have this yet.

data.title: Adopt TypeScript 2.3
data.body: Tracking adoption of TypeScript 2.3 for April release

data.title: TypeScript: DiagnosticsCategory Warning is not honored
data.body:
The video below demonstrates tslint running as a language server plugin. Notice that the tslint warnings show up as errors. However, in the code the DiagnosticCategory is set to `Warning`.

![tslint-language-service](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/25097471/f4b68d98-23a4-11e7-9849-9069f1923cc7.gif)

This is the code that creates the diagnostic https://github.com/egamma/tslint-language-service/blob/master/src/index.ts#L61

data.title: Support to distinguish diagnostics from TS from the diagnostics from a language server plugin.
data.body:
Experimenting with tslint running as a language server plugin. 

When providing the diagnostics from tslint from the language server plugin decorator, then the diagnostics cannot be distinguished from the original typescript diagnostics, see below:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/25098822/42bcb152-23aa-11e7-8483-cc58840c8f3b.png)

With the existing vscode-tslint extension we prefix the message with the source of the diagnostic, e.g., `tslint`.

data.body:

I can't figure out why `onmessage` is sorted first when `onMessage` is an exact case-sensitive match. Matching is case-sensitive in other cases:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/25098823/d333fa52-235e-11e7-910f-c6139544523b.png)

data.title: Open editors view goes ballistic with many changes
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. bring up many editors (e.g. search for `copyright` in `*.ts` in our workspace and replace with `copyright2`)
2. replace all (have auto save disabled)
3. open "Open Editors" view and "Save All"

=> for each editor saving the entire tree refreshes
=> with the number of editors actually opened this seems to trigger much more work (quadratic?)
=> the entire UI stalls and becomes unusable

I know this used to work much better some months ago so this must be a regression with how we refresh the tree from editor changes

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25096444/84057d60-23a0-11e7-9b7b-cd33ee2c4ece.png)

[CPU-20170417T190319.cpuprofile.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/926126/CPU-20170417T190319.cpuprofile.zip)

data.title: apt package should re-enable itself when a new version is installed if it was disabled by an OS upgrade
data.body:
For example, upgrading Ubuntu 16.10 to 17.04 will result in the following in `/etc/apt/sources.list.d/vscode.list`:

```
# deb [arch=amd64] http://packages.microsoft.com/repos/vscode stable main # disabled on upgrade to zesty
```

We should check if `# disabled on upgrade to ...` exists and uncomment it if so.

data.title: Send Alt (meta) key in integrated terminal
data.body:
I have keyboard shortcuts under my shell zsh and tmux, because of integrated terminal not sending `Alt` (or meta) key, they doesn't work. Instead of they are making special characters like ``, which is default behaviour. It would be cool if `Alt` key works like in other terminal emulators.
Sorry if duplicate, searched but I couldn't find related issue.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.12
- OS Version: 10.12.4

data.title: Debugger won't start for PowerShell, Python, etc.
data.body:
In relation to https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/682, I've been encountering some scenarios where the debugger hangs. However, I've reached a point in my VSCode session where the debugger simply will not start at all. Nothing new is showing up in the VSCode PowerShell Extension logs, when I attempt to start the debugger, so I am suspicious of VSCode itself having a transient error state in the debug adapter interface.

I've already tried restarting the PowerShell session, and PowerShell 6.0 is currently showing as active in the status bar, but no matter what, I can't start the debugger. I've tried opening different files to start the debugger, but no file will allow me to invoke the debugger. In fact, I can't even call the `Debug: Start Without Debugging` command from the Command Palette. The entire VSCode debugger seems to be hung. 

At the top of the VSCode window, the debug commands are visible, but are greyed out, and cannot be clicked on.

I opened the VSCode Developer Tools and found the following items in the console logs:


data.title: window.openFilesInNewWindow set to "on" allows the opening of the same file every time
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Linux (Antergos Linux 16.11-ISO-Rolling)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Set window.openFilesInNewWindow to "on".
2.In your terminal, enter
`/usr/local/VSCode-linux-x64/bin/code .zshrc`
five times.
You will see five vscode windows open, all with same open file. It happens even with an absolute path for .zshrc.

data.title: Can't Cmd+A in file field in save dialog
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. New file
2. Save (Cmd+S)
3. Browse to a directory using mouse
4. Click back to filename field
5. Shows default filename of untitled
6. can't Cmd+A to select text for overwriting field value

I realize the filename is selected-all by default but that selection is lost when directories are interacted with

data.title: [Feature-Request] Keybinding to toggle 'Find in selection'
data.body:
After opening the 'find' dialog with `ctrl + f`, there are keybindings for every other button on the dialog except for 'Find in selection':

Match Case (`Alt + C`)
Match Whole Word (`Alt + W`)
Toggle regex (`Alt + R`)
Previous match (`Shift + F3`)
Next Match (`F3`)
Close (`Escape`)

I recommend adding an editor command "Toggle 'Find in selection'" with a default keybinding of `Alt + S`

data.title: drag-and-drop mouse cursors getting stuck
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `Version 1.12.0-insider  Commit 200c4d10571e252fc1b8ead1549d4259b120793c  Date 2017-04-17T06:11:54.909Z`
- OS Version: `Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.15063]`

Steps to Reproduce:

1. have the `editor.dragAndDrop` setting enabled
2. put the mouse cursor over any non-empty line of text in an editor
3. hold down ctrl, simply click once, release ctrl

the cursor is now "copy" even though it should be "text", until you select some text and click once

another one:

1. have the `editor.dragAndDrop` setting enabled
2. put the mouse cursor over any non-empty line of text in an editor
3. push down ctrl, push down LMB (left mouse button), release ctrl, release LMB

the cursor is now "default" even though it should be "text", until you select some text and click once

if it doesn't work for you, try again with a different line of text

i found https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24616 but it's for "drag and drop disabled" and someone said that bug has already been fixed so i don't think it's related to this one

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/24602 looks kinda relevant too but it says `already fixed in latest one` (4 days ago) and i'm having the bug with vscode updated today

data.title: [sass] Incorrect validation when using @error directive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 
  Version 1.11.2
  Commit 6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e
  Date 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z
  Shell 1.4.6
  Renderer 53.0.2785.143
  Node 6.5.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Creators Update

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a Sass file '.scss'
2. Add a Mixin

```scss

@mixin bp-small {

  @error 'Error';

}

```
The following error occurs:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2516266/25090491/e5beec4a-2359-11e7-856f-c1d7255f4fd4.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2516266/25090560/4b50e32e-235a-11e7-8fd4-a55eee119f81.png)

The order doesnt  affect the error:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2516266/25090417/71518dc2-2359-11e7-8aa4-84383d212def.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2516266/25090376/2f335196-2359-11e7-9e7b-916e30edb8a0.png)
